body.name: Easy Cloud 120mm RGB Fans Up to 1200 RPM CPU Computer Cooling Cooler Quiet Hydraulic Bearing Gaming PC Fans with Power Supply Plug 3 Pack Ventiladores PC for Computer Case & Radiator, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: 【Stable IDE Connector】Our rgb case fans is engineered for convenience and reliability. With its IDE PSU connector, simplify cable management and expand your RGB setup effortlessly. Connect multiple pc case fans in a series without hassle. Unlike many other computer case fans connectors in the market, our gaming pc fans is engineered for superior stability, virtually eliminating the risk of damage to your valuable computer components

【Quiet PC Fans】Strike the perfect balance between airflow and noise with a 1200 RPM fan speed and 38 CFM airflow. The revised curve blades ensure efficient cooling while minimizing noise levels (Noise level is 23dBA)
【Vibrant RGB Illumination】Our pc fans 120mm transform your PC into a dazzling light show with vivid RGB lighting, enhance the aesthetics of your gaming rig or workstation

【Fit CPU and Radiator】Experience top-notch cooling performance with our ventiladors para pc, designed for efficiency and compatibility. Whether you're using it as a CPU cooling fan or with a radiator, this rgb pc fans is engineered to deliver exceptional cooling results. Upgrade your PC aesthetics and cooling capabilities today!
【Customer Support】We strive to offer the excellent services out of your expectations. If you have any problems with our product, please feel free to contact us at anytime

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good pc fans
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been using the fans for about two days now and they’re really really good. I rated them for stars because they’re a tiny bit loud but the LED work really well and are pretty bright. One thing I did not like about them was they use a two pin connector and you can’t connect them to your motherboard. Overall, the fans are really good for the price and I’m looking to use them for my next builds. I just really hope that they can fix the sound issue because they can get a little loud.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: They look fantastic, and I was slightly worried because some Molex connection fans are set way too high (Montech, that’s you) but these are at the perfect balance of airflow and sound. Almost dead quiet!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars I'm not a "fan"
reviews.reviewText: These fans look ok and are decently quite but the rgb is lackluster and can you believe it they didn't even come with any 4pin rgb much less 3 pin argb connectors so the rgb you see isn't even addressable! I couldn't believe it. For that I automatically can't recommend these fans unless you don't have rgb connection on your motherboard anyway. Should be better explained in ad.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Fans work great!
reviews.reviewText: These fans work as they should. Color is great and easy to install. Only reason I’m putting a 3 star is because I was planning on continuing to purchase these for all of my builds. But after I ordered 4 packs, they raised the price from 9.99 to 12.99. Now I’d rather buy somewhere else as they’ll probably keep raising the price as I buy them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent RGB case fans, but no fan or ARGB controls
reviews.reviewText: These are decent case fans for a PC. They are not controllable, either in terms of the fan speeds or the RGB, so if you have a system like I-Cue or Chroma, these fans will light up but will only cycle the colors and will not correspond with the rest of your lighting. They also will only operate at the preset speed of around 1200 RPM, which is adequate for a case intake or exhaust setup. They connect via a 4-pin Molex connector so getting them power shouldn't be an issue and as long as you do not have a long cable run for your fans, you should be OK. My case already had some cycling fans so the addition of these did not take away from my killer RGB setup (Sarcasm intended). I am more concerned with having adequate airflow, and these are fairly quiet and do provide a good amount of airflow for the size. At this price, if you are not worried about the RGB being a static pattern, go for it. They get the job done and are pretty quiet comparatively.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Nice fans! The RGB looks great and they don't make too much noise either.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Short cables, completely fixed RGBs.
reviews.reviewText: So the cables are rather short. I barely got the setup i am using. (Replaced a dying fan and removed the plain case fan, went from 1 intake and 3 exhaust. To 2 intake and 3 exhaust.The RGBs have no controls and no connections to the motherboard. They connect directly to the PSU via 4 pin connectors but only use 2 pins. The other 2 holes are empty.Because of the short cables, and lack of even a on/off toggle i feel that these are worth a 2.5 but the system lacks those half marks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap molex fans with no control.
reviews.reviewText: This is a basic set of three 120mm fans. The fans themselves have no way to control their speeds. They connect with the 4 pin Molex connector. They don't use PWM or standard fan headers. The RGB is static and there is no way to change the lighting. It's always the same, so if you're wanting to use one color at a time these fans aren't for you. These fans don't move a ton of air because they spin at 1200 RPM. They are slow, quiet, but don't move much air. They are okay for a budget builds, but for a high end RGB build these would not be the best choice.

Son buenos para una pc gaming de entrada, OJO, se conectan a la fuente, asi que tienen que tener una fuente No modular, en la publicacion dicen que son de 1200 RPM pero en la caja que llego decian que son de 1800 RPM, llego en buen estado, se tardaron 5 dias aprox, bajaron mis tempreaturas de 75-80 grados a 60-63 jugando Warzone, recomendables para una pc de entrada o una pc antigua, PD, el RGB se ve bien e ilumina muy lindo la pc
